sections.heading: by obligor.(a) An obligor may contest the validity or enforcement of an income withholding order issued in another state and received directly by an employer in this state by registering the order in a tribunal of this state and filing a contest to that order as provided in sections 42-736 to 42-747
sections.text: by obligor.(a) An obligor may contest the validity or enforcement of an income withholding order issued in another state and received directly by an employer in this state by registering the order in a tribunal of this state and filing a contest to that order as provided in sections 42-736 to 42-747.04 or otherwise contesting the order in the same manner as if the order had been issued by a tribunal of this state.(b) The obligor shall give notice of the contest to:(1) a support enforcement agency providing services to the obligee;(2) each employer that has directly received an income withholding order relating to the obligor; and(3) the person designated to receive payments in the income withholding order or, if no person is designated, to the obligee.SourceLaws 1997, LB 727, § 15;Laws 2003, LB 148, § 74;Laws 2015, LB415, § 32.

42-734.05.Contest by obligor.

(a) An obligor may contest the validity or enforcement of an income withholding order issued in another state and received directly by an employer in this state by registering the order in a tribunal of this state and filing a contest to that order as provided in sections 42-736 to 42-747.04 or otherwise contesting the order in the same manner as if the order had been issued by a tribunal of this state.

(b) The obligor shall give notice of the contest to:

(1) a support enforcement agency providing services to the obligee;

(2) each employer that has directly received an income withholding order relating to the obligor; and

(3) the person designated to receive payments in the income withholding order or, if no person is designated, to the obligee.

SourceLaws 1997, LB 727, § 15;Laws 2003, LB 148, § 74;Laws 2015, LB415, § 32.
